text:
-[ Telephone rings ]
-Brian. I'm Erica.

We spoke on the phone.
-[ Laughs ]

-Thank you for coming in.
Ted sends his apologies.

-Oh, please.
I know what's on his plate.

Lester Thompson
is lucky to have him.

-Oh, well,
I don't want to talk about them.

I want to know what
we can do for you.
-I want to kill Kevin Malone.

-Uh, what?
-Don't get me wrong.

I love him.
I love the role.

It has given me
basically everything I have.
But it has come with a cost.

-It typecast you.
-Exactly.
I want the world to see

that I can perform dramatic
roles at an Oscar-worthy level.

-Oscar-worthy.
-Yes, Oscar-worthy.
[ Knock on window ]

-Hey, it's Kevin Malone!
How's it going?

-[ As Malone ]
Nice! Thanks for asking.
-Yes!

-[ Normal voice ] Gotta give
the people what they want.

-Okay, Brian,
about what you want.

It's unheard of
for a comedic actor

to successfully transition
into --

-No, it's not.
It's happened many times.

Robin Williams,
Jamie Foxx, Tom Hanks.

-Okay,
but those are the exceptions

that make people think it's
not a rule, but it is.

-Maybe. But I want to talk to
one of them to find out
how they did it anyway.

-And it just so happens
Ted represents Tom Hanks.

-All I'm asking for
is one meeting with Tom Hanks.
-Just the one?

-Just one.
-Mm.
